title: Weak validation: electron/main.ts:286 checks for audio stream by searching stderr string - fragile approach
TypeScript strict mode disabled: noUnusedLocals and noUnusedParameters set to false in tsconfig.json
Hardcoded path construction: electron/main.ts:17,267 uses process.cwd() for tmp dir - breaks if cwd changes or app packaged
Security: electron/main.ts:56-64 appfile protocol handler lacks path traversal protection - validates decode but not directory escape
Performance: electron/main.ts:281-290 audio probe blocks with runFFmpeg instead of ffprobe - inefficient and parses stderr instead of JSON
Architecture violation: src/App.tsx:539 lines exceeds 300-line component guideline from CLAUDE.md - split into features/AudioProcessor and features/VideoPreview
Test coverage gap: src/__tests__/app.test.tsx only has smoke tests - no unit tests for FFmpeg filter chain builders in electron/main.ts:97-232
Missing error handling: electron/main.ts:85 uses non-null assertion on mainWindow without checking if it exists
Memory leak: src/components/Knob.tsx:77-99 useEffect cleanup may not fire if component unmounts during drag
Missing validation: src/App.tsx:109-110 uses non-null assertion on result paths without checking success first
Resource leak: electron/main.ts:234-258 runFFmpeg spawned processes not tracked - no cleanup on app quit or window close
Inline styles bloat: App.tsx contains 400+ lines of inline React styles - extract to CSS/styled components
Unused import: 'resolve' at vite.config.ts:5 is imported but never used
Accessibility: src/App.tsx:532 video element missing aria-label and keyboard controls
Missing error handling: electron/main.ts:234-258 runFFmpeg does not handle spawn timeout or process kill
Missing error handling: electron/main.ts:261 renderPreview handler doesn't validate file path exists before processing
Missing validation: electron/main.ts:261-401 render-preview IPC handler accepts user paths without existence/permission checks before FFmpeg execution
Unused import: src/components/Knob.tsx:1 imports useState but only uses it for Toggle component - consider splitting file
Code duplication: electron/main.ts:305-326 and 358-391 contain nearly identical fallback logic - extract helper
Missing progress reporting: electron/main.ts:234-258 runFFmpeg captures stderr but does not parse FFmpeg progress for UI feedback during long renders
Security: electron/main.ts:43-51 appfile protocol registered with bypassCSP=true - potential XSS risk if renderer serves untrusted content
Code organization: src/components/Knob.tsx exports both Knob and Toggle - violates single responsibility
Test coverage: src/__tests__/app.test.tsx contains only trivial smoke tests - no actual component testing
Dead code: .gitignore:3 ignores dist-electron but vite.config.ts:15,29 builds to dist-electron - verify this is intentional for dev workflow
Security: electron/main.ts:60 allows resolving any absolute path via appfile protocol without validation
Temp file accumulation: electron/main.ts:267-268,274-277 creates uniquely named preview files but no automatic cleanup strategy
Component size violation: App.tsx at 538 lines exceeds architectural limit of 300 lines per component
Missing cancellation: electron/main.ts:234-258 runFFmpeg returns Promise but provides no way to cancel in-progress renders from UI
Missing edge case handling: electron/main.ts:305-326,358-391 video copy fallback to re-encode but no fallback if re-encode also fails
Duplicate gradient IDs: src/components/Knob.tsx:132-140 uses size-based IDs that may collide with multiple knobs
Hardcoded value: electron/main.ts:17 uses process.cwd() for tmp directory - should use app.getPath('temp')
Missing dist directory in gitignore: .gitignore missing dist/ folder referenced in vite.config.ts:37 and package.json:38-40
Performance: src/App.tsx:88-124 handleRender not memoized with useCallback dependencies - may cause unnecessary re-renders
Missing type safety: src/App.tsx:11-27 duplicates types from shared/types.ts instead of importing Window interface
Missing cleanup: electron/main.ts:274-278 manually deletes files but no error handling if deletion fails
